required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The PRESS RA: Protein and Resistance Exercise Supplementation Study for Rheumatoid Arthritis
clinical_study.official_title: The PRESS RA Study: Protein and Resistance Exercise Supplementation Study for Rheumatoid Arthritis

collaborator.agency: American College of Rheumatology Research and Education Foundation

brief_summary.textblock: This study will evaluate if the combination of resistance exercise and protein supplementation will increase muscle strength and muscle mass among older individuals with rheumatoid arthritis (RA).

detailed_description.textblock: This study proposes a randomized trial to evaluate a tailored 16-week resistance exercise program, in combination with protein supplementation, for older individuals with RA. The exercise protocol in this study is distinctive because it combines dynamic and isometric (static) resistance exercise performed on specialized equipment that can accommodate the range of motion limitations frequently encountered in the older RA population. This study will also begin to evaluate if additional benefit can be achieved with daily protein supplementation

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Investigator)

primary_outcome.description: measured by DEXA (lean mass vs fat mass)
measured by hand grip and biodex

arm_group.description: Participants will be enrolled in a twice weekly resistance exercise program. They will receive a carbohydrate supplement to take twice daily (once after exercise).
Participants will be enrolled in a twice weekly resistance exercise program. They will receive a twice daily protein supplement (once after exercise).

intervention.description: The twice daily placebo will consist of a carbohydrate and a small amount of protein
ALL participants will be enrolled in an individually supervised twice weekly (for 16 weeks) resistance exercise program

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- age 60-95 years
- diagnosis of rheumatoid arthritis
- willing to participate in twice weekly exercise sessions
Exclusion Criteria:
- cognitive impairment
- recent heart surgery (within past 12 months)
- severe kidney disease
- use of supplemental oxygen
- presence of pacemaker
- diabetes that requires insulin for management
- allergy to soy or milk
